Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel with airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: vanessadb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in August. We had 2 communicating rooms for us 4 (our 2 kids-4 and 1- my husband and I), taking advantage of their family offer: book the second room for half price. We paid 118 euros in total for these 2 rooms, which we found to be a great price. The shuttle from and to the airport is complimentary and a short 5min ride away. The subway station is a short walk (100m) away and only minutes from the city center. We even cabbed it for the return as the kids were exhausted and only paid 10euros for the ride. The rooms are new, modern and clean. Each room has either 2 double beds or a Queen size bed, as well as a sofa bed. Black out blinds made the rooms nice and dark. The bathrooms were nice: new and large. No bathtub, only shower. The AC can be set to whatever you want it. The hotel had a very nice pool, and it was full of kids, friends for our kids to play with. The restaurant had a nice patio to eat outside, with a very good children's menu. The food was ok, a bit expensive though as far as quantity/price, especially when you compare it to Madrid restaurants. All in all a really nice family hotel where we plan to stay when we go to Madrid with our kids.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK. Probably 3.5.”
Reviews.Author: ShugsyLondon
Reviews.Content: There you go - that's about it for this hotel - it's OK... What do I like about it: > It's very close to the airport - great if you arrive late or need to rush off after a meeting > It has a metro stop very near > It is metres from my client's office > It's quiet > It has an amazing huge park right next door Have stayed further into town before now but it's noisy and busy and full of car fumes. This hotel yes is a little way out of town but that makes it a quiet location. And the park is fantastic - great for running, walking and cycling. With water running round it to boot - and that's a rare thing for Madrid - water !! I would consider staying here for leisure because of that fact. BUT unlike the previous reviewer - NO NO NO - don't ever eat dinner in a Spanish hotel restaurant unless you are staing 5*. It's a fairly miserable experience. The metro is cheap and clean and taxis are the same. If I was staying here for leisure with the kids I would eat Spanish style for lunch = big and long in the centre of town and then return for a snack at the hotel. The rooms are just fine - very clean, quite modern and room enough for 2 but probably yes a little small with 2 kids on top of that ! And the pool is just right - though not heated and salt water - that was a shock when I lept in after an hour's run round the park in 25 degrees heat !!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely an airport hotel with nothing much around it”
Reviews.Author: Mariafromnz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in August on our way back home to London. We chose it because it is close to the airport, and also because the price was far more reasonable than hotels in the centre of Madrid. Also, it offered 'family' rooms when not a lot of hotels do. The family room consisted of a double bed and sofa bed that converted into 2 single beds for the children. It was fine, except the room was cramped even without the sofa bed extended. The bathroom was also small, and an odd configuration with the toilet against one wall, a bidet next to the toilet and in front of the bath. The room was quiet however, and seemed fairly clean. The hotel also had a pool, which was great for the kids. The hotel had a restaurant which we ate lunch and dinner at. The food was ok- standard fare - and they only offered burger and fries, pizza and fries or fish fingers and fries for the kids. The food that we had for lunch was doused in so much oil that it was almost inedible. The night that we ate in the hotel the wait for our food was around 45 minutes, which considering the time and the fact that we had children with us was inexcusable. We asked for a discount on the total food bill for our stay (which consisted of lunch, dinner and breakfast for 2 days) and all they offered was 20Euro, which I felt was not very generous at all. There is a hotel literally next door to this one (the Pullman) and it had a couple of restaurants. We tried the cafe one evening and although the food was pleasant, there wasn't much of it for what they charged, and again, service was extremely slow. Staff at the Novotel were a mixed bag. Some were friendly, others were not very approachable and made us feel like we were being annoying. The area around the hotel is mainly offices it seems and there is literally nowhere else nearby to eat. There is a shopping centre about 10mins walk away, but that only has fast food chain restaurants. The hotel is located close to the metro and it's 2 traiins into the centre of madrid, which is quite convenient. They also offer a free shuttle to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for the airport and metro”
Reviews.Author: traveller67Chorley
Reviews.Content: A great position close to the metro so easy to get to and away from. Hotel has a lovely pool and breakfast was excellent. It took us 30 mins to get to 'Sol' on the metro so not in the heart of the city but we were needing to be close to the airport. The hotel has a bus shuttle service to the airport which takes about 10 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, convenient to city”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good choice for stop over in Madrid. Close to Metro, city center in less than 30min for 2 euros. Convenient Pickup and Dropoff at the airport, on the 1/2 hour, I do not know the earliest or latest pickup or dropoff.

Reviews.Title: “15 min frim tbe airport”
Reviews.Author: ahva63
Reviews.Content: Clean and functional. Convinient. The bar and breakfast are relatively expensive.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at this hotel when ever we fly into Madrid from the USA . We use the shuttle to and from the airport from where we rent a car to drive down to Marbella. The metro is so close and easy to use for access to downtown Madrid. The rooms are very nice and the beds are comfortable. The only bad thing for us is that the fifth floor is smoking. The non-smoking rooms on that floor still have a smoking aroma. The last time we stayed there, the front desk accomodated us and switched us to a room on the lower non-smoking floors.

Reviews.Title: “Location better than expected”
Reviews.Author: RebekahYork
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Room clean and comfortable with fridge and tea/coffee facilities. Good breakfast buffet, but awful boom boom pop music in dining room. Good location for conference facilities/feria and airport. 2 minutes from metro and regular bus service. Wonderful Juan Carlos Park 3 minutes walk away - no mention of this in hotel. Acres of parkland and water gardens. Several cafes nearby and El Corte about 10 minutes walk down main road. Not so handy for central Madrid as involves 2 changes on metro, but frequent service.

Reviews.Title: “an ok novotel, a bit far from town”
Reviews.Author: bruno1234Brussels
Reviews.Content: ideal location if you need to be close to the airport but about 45 minutes to go downtown by metro standard, clean Novotel rooms but refurbished fairly recently, so ok swimming pool still closed mid april very friendly staff reasonably priced restaurant (3 course menu 18 Euro, kids menu 9.75 Euro, good wine list starting at 15 Euro);stayed twice in april, 2 dinners, one OK, one actually quiet good, above average for this type of hotels breakfast at 16.5 Euro is expensive but good room rates including breakfast are available if you book early

Reviews.Title: “Very flexible and good for an atipic group”
Reviews.Author: sand_man_ro
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Novotel Campo de la Naciones for one night during our transit through Madrid. Although we've been quite a large group (15) with age from 1 to 40+ the hotel staff managed to be flexible enough to make our stay as comfortable as possible. If you're looking for a nice & quiet place to stay NCdlN is a very good option. although it is at approx 10km to city center it's very well connected to Barajas and any other point by the subway network.

Reviews.Title: “Usual Novotel experience”
Reviews.Author: tripperhov
Reviews.Content: This was the first stay. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the Campo de las Naciones metro station and is a quick metro journey from the airport. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was the standard Novotel design and a good size, equipped with a flat screen TV, tea/coffee facilities, fridge, internet (extra charge) and an electronic safe. The bed was comfortable. Breakfast was continental, a bit pricy. There is an outdoor swimming pool, but it was too cold to use on my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the fair (Feria)”
Reviews.Author: picturedesk2010
Reviews.Content: If you need to be close to the Fair, for a convention, and still have quick access to the Metro de Madrid to get anywhere in the city in 30 mins or less, this is it. Also close to Barajas, with a shuttle service. Rooms are nicely designed, a tiny bit tired but still good design, friendly service, reasonable restaurant. There is very little around this hotel or the neighboring Pullman in terms of restaurants and other services, apart from the restaurants in the Feria...so it is really for best for business. The advance-purchase deals are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Campo de las Naciones”
Reviews.Author: henriquemourao
Reviews.Content: 1 block from underground nice staff, delicious breakfast, confortable beds, very suitable for overnight if you fly connecting in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at the Novotel”
Reviews.Author: MartinAdrogué
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Novotel before taking a flight to Boston. It's location is very convenient for the airport, a 5 min taxi ride. The hotel is very well kept. Nice, contemporary lobby and friendly staff. The room was quite spacious and modern, typical of a chain, business hotel. I had a very good experience and definitely recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with very good service.”
Reviews.Author: Hennyreinhardt
Reviews.Content: We are family (4 adults + 2 children). Booked via accors website 3 months before for 4 nights and got special price. We are satisfied and recommend to stay in this hotel. From airport, the information center officer in the airport T2 was very helpfull and the direction to the shelter bus is also very clear. The mini bus come every 30 min and takes 10 min to the hotel. The receptions were very friendly and the rooms also clean. The breakfast was always the same everyday, but it's Ok because lots of choices. The only one negative is no shops and no restaurants nearby. To eat and to buy, we must take the Metro to the others stations. Lucky, that the Metro is just 300 metres from the hotel's door.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay but nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: ka0z
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. We had 2 triple rooms and a double. There are huge differences between these 2 types that they fail to mention anywhere: -triple rooms are located on the first floor which is not renovated. This shows as tiles are broken in the bathroom and generally the rooms have those 80's feeling. Definitely not up to other 4* hotel rooms I stayed in. -double room was locted on the 4th floor, in the non-smoking section. There were no problems with it, i'd generally call that a 3-4* hotel room. The automated courtains are funny but it wasnt practical at all. The minibar is HEAVILY overpriced, 3€ for a small bottle of water, 4€ for anything else is just a ripoff. The supermarket is literally 10 mins away... When I booked the room it said that both types have kettles. For the triple room this is not true, you have to request one and only if they can find one you get it... Which they got for us a day late. That is not what I expected as an A|Club member. Also they provided only 2 sets of towels for the triple rooms... What on earth were they thinking? Front desk staff were ok, not so responsive as I expected. Overall we spent an ok time there but I would not be keen on returning...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great food”
Reviews.Author: Morues
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a conference. Hotel was ok and restaurant of the hotel is really good. Good location if you go to the convetion centre. Room was ok but bed was not perfect. But for the value and price paid, no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: stoker6924
Reviews.Content: The Novotel was a little larger than your standard European hotel room. Staff was courteous and helpful. Hotel restaurant provided good food at a reasonable price. The hotel is about 45 minutes by metro to the center of Madrid, that was the only knock on this hotel. If you have busines at the Feria de Madrid , this is a great hotel within walking distance. Do yourself a favor if you stay here, make sure you walk over to the park Juan Carlos, absolutely beautiful park.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel okay, but Service not so much...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: - Novotel (Accor) shuttle bus only every 30 minutes (many other hotel chain busses had a considerably shorter cycle time). - One time the Accor bus drove by without picking people up (one other passenger was waiting with me). - Called Novotel reception to complain which did not seem to be "impressed" by this. - After my arrival, reception personnel was rather short on answering questions and did not seem very understanding, especially in the morning on my departure. - had to wait rather long for the waitor during dinner (food quality was good though) - same long waiting times at the bar in the late afternoon and evening This was the first and probably last time for me at "Campo de las Naciones". Have stayed two times at Novotel "Puente de la Paz" before and rather stay there if in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “good business location & fair prices”
Reviews.Author: pjm_pt
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is your typical hotel close to a business park. Fairly nice, modern-looking rooms, internet connection, good & comfortable bed. The buffet breakfast was average, with a somewhat limited choice. The a/c in my room was (very) noisy, but otherwise the hotel is fairly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “If you expect a 3starts you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: penabranca
Reviews.Content: Make sure you state you do NOT want a smoker's room. The whole 5th floor smells like an ash tray. Staff at the reception not pleasant at all: every question we ask seems to bother them. Expect no advice for what to do in the area, nor directions for where is the 15min walking distance gym, nor when is the Wi-Fi (very slow connection from my room, forget using Skype) coming back when it suddenly breaks down. Very positive note for the restaurant staff: extremely helpful particularly if you speak some sort of spanish. Breakfast very nice, pool area very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Madrid Campo de las Naciones”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived on an early flight long before "official" check-in time, but we were given a room immediately, which was remarkable. The receptionists were very friendly and helpful and even ordered and paid for a taxi to the airport the next day, as the hotel's shuttle was full and couldn't accommodate us. As the hotel is near the airport and not near the city centre, we battled a little bit with the underground at first, but once we understood how it worked, we could travel easily and quickly to any destination of our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Solid family hotel”
Reviews.Author: clarajane2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in July with family and friends. Close to airport and free shuttle bus to and from airport. Not in the centre but with metro stop close by with cheap transport into city centre.Typical Novotel rooms and good buffet breakfast. Two outside pools with bars, restaurant and bar in hotel, games corner for children, friendly and helpful staff. Would stay here again. Very good deals for families.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel or Etap...?”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rather disappointed with this 4 star Novotel - while its location is brilliantly close to the Airport, and also the shopping chain El Corte Ingles and the metro system, its actual rooms were depressing. I booked here because i am a fan of the Accor chain, and Novotel has always had a great reputation. However on this occasion, the room was lacking any inspiration, the air conditioning rattled all night which is quite disruptive to sleep. The motorised blind is good in theory but doesnt prevent the sun shining through of a morning, so therefore fails as a block out blind. There are no liners in the bins, the bathroom is bare and the shower worked with minimal water pressure. Walking in i thought i was in their budget version ETAP and certainly did not feel as if i was in a 4 star hotel. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lumensaw
Reviews.Content: Our room had a very unpleasant smell, and the AC was quite noisy. Not very impressed with the quality of the breakfast either. Receptionists were correct, but didn't get out of their way to help. A little more professionalism wouldn't hurt. Parking is comber some and pricey, and the directions given at the front desk hard to follow. It should be written down and properly explained, to save the customer the 20 extra minutes that it takes to get out of the place. I wish we had known before hand. we would have chosen street parking instead!! With so many other options, i doubt we will choose this hotel in the future. Sorry to say. It's not very often that I write negative feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Typical conference Hotel - expensive for it value.”
Reviews.Author: MoooTi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for reason of visiting conference in the congress area nearby. Hotel was Ok , clean and very expensive. Later on I have found that getting to the conference by metro can save lot of money by staying in the city or just little bit far away.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in a convenient location for airport and exhibitions”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Once I found the hotel, despite my SatNav finding the location I could not actually see the hotel at all until I drove around and finally saw a sign, I was pleasantly surprised. Booked a bargain price and expected less. Not far from airport, a good position outside city centre. Not much around though to do for a break. Rooms are well presented, comfortable and clean. Internet was included and worked well, although breakfast appeared to be included and then was actually an extra. Breakfast selection pretty good in a nice restaurant setting. Staff friendly, although when I arrived late in the night was surprised for Spain there was no food on! Recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “1 hour wait at airport for shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The stay was good. However after a long flight from Toronto we had to wait for 1/2 hour for the shuttle to arrive. We were told that the shuttle was full and to wait for the next shuttle which was supposed to come in 10 minutes but showed up after 1/2 hour.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely, clean and spacious hotel and room. Free wi-fi although not enough coverage in the room (low signal). Serves meal till late at night which was a great bonus as our flight arrived at 10pm. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Conferences in the Area.”
Reviews.Author: Jubbin55
Reviews.Content: To get there; The hotel has a half hourly pick up from the Barajas Airport. The hotel pick up point is difficult to find but is well marked. But once you find it and get onto the van the hotel is close by. If you cannot get the shuttle the other option is to take the Metro to Campo De La Naciones. From the metro it is 10 minute walk to the hotel which can be taxing with luggage so it is worth waiting 30 minutes for the hotel shuttle. Well I never take cabs so I have no idea how much that costs, Good Points 1. The Hotel is clean and of good standard. The rooms and bathrooms are comfortable. 2. The automatic window blinds are great 3. The internet is free but the connection is always getting off and on 4. The breakfast is good Bad points 1. The location is excellent for the convention centres close by but needs 30 minutes of Metro travel and two line changes to reach the city centre. The Metro is cheap at 1 euro/ trip. Probably cheapest in Europe. The quickest connection to the Centre is to take Line 8 from Campo to Columbia and then take Line 8 (Purple) to Princepe De Vegara and finally the Red line (Line 2) to Sol or Opera to reach most of the important places in Central Madrid 2. The hotel being located so far there are few options for eating and drinking other than the overpriced hotel restaurant. There is a large super market about a km from the hotel and some restaurants including a Mac Donalds. 3. I had booked my room through the conference organizers and hence did not get the best rates also the points are not added on you AClub. It is better to book directly through the Accor Website for the best deals and to earn miles/ AClub Points. 4. Spaniards are not very good at customer care. So I do not think you will get the kind of attention at Novotel that you would get at other Novotel Hotels elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: karensolihull
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel for 1 night on a 24 hour stop over to Madrid. Free airport shuttle was convenient, had to wait 20 mins or so but not a problem. Hotel is lovely and modern and spotlessly clean in the public areas and the bedrooms. We loved the bedroom, comft beds, nice bathroom, and a great blind that goes up and down with a switch - my daughter loved that!!! Room was really quiet and the pool area looked gorgeous, not quite warm enough for that in February unfortunately. Didnt use the restaurant but it looked nice and got fairly busy, a touch expensive but thats the way with most airport hotels we've been to. Metro was 150 metres from the hotel and was easy, clean and seemed safe to use. We got into the centre of Madrid in minutes, had to change once and it only cost 1 euro each, a real bargain. Overall we enjoyed our short stay at this hotel and I think if we went back to Madrid we would stay there again rather than in the centre as it was so easy to get around and lovely to come back to a quiet hotel for a great nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I arrived just before mid night and was give the card to a room which was dirty / not made up. Then when I went to reception I was offered a disable or smoking room only. I have not exprereinced this kind of thing before

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, Nice room”
Reviews.Author: MarMourinho
Reviews.Content: If are coming to work in FIESA ou Campo de las naciones it's your best option. The rooms are ok and the breakfast it's very good. The mini-bar was the only problem, I had a already open water bottle. If the plan is visiting the city it's far.

Reviews.Title: “Cleaning leaves a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: JohannaGuerrero
Reviews.Content: First of all, we weren't advised that the twin room in this hotel means that one of the guests should sleep on a coach though we called to the hotel beforehand because in the voucher our room was marked as a double. In my opinion, cleaning is the most important thing about a hotel, especially if we are talking about a quite expensive four star hotel like this. The room we were accomodated in was dusty as if it wasn't cleaned for months: tha carpet wasn't vacuumed up properly, there were strange whitish spots on the blanket of the coach (so finally the colleague of mine and I had to sleep in the same double bed), there were hairs on the pillow and to top it all off, there was only one set of towells in the bathroom. Well, we asked for the second set of towels and in 5 minutes we had it. Also, we left a note to our cleaning lady kindly asking her to clean our room better. In the third day of our stay the room was really clean and it had being cleaned properly till our check out. Our stay was in October and we really liked the way the hotel was decorated for Halloween. The hotel is conviniently located within a walking distance to IFEMA. The best thing about the hotel is the food in the restaurant that was really delicious and we were tasting a new dish every day over the week of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “great deal on airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stopped over in Madrid for the night before catching our flight home to the U.S. This hotel is conveniently located to airport (with shuttle service), comfortable, clean, good (not great) restaurant. Best of all, we received FREE adjoining room for our two teenage girls. Perfect to meet our needs. Only strange problem was that they inexplicably keep the red-blue-green flashing lights in the swimming pool on all night. Sort of like having a neon sign outside your window if your room happens to overlook the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel - unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Alycidon
Reviews.Content: The easy bit first, this is a standard Novotel which means you get a decent, contemporary room with a good quality fittings and furnishings, can't fault any of this at all. The only problem with the room was a toilet that decided to block with fairly unpleasant results - not what you expect in a modern 4 star hotel. Luckily it happened when we were packed and ready to go so it wasn't a big problem for us. The food was indifferent and incredibly expensive. Four club sandwiches and four soft drinks = 35 euros! Outrageous! The buffet breakfast was ghastly, the hot food was stone cold and the different food items were randomly placed on tables around the restaurant with the result that we kept discovering new items to eat as the meal went on. Which was just as well as I've never had cold bacon and eggs before and had to leave it after the first mouthful. Don't pay extra for the breakfast, it's not worth it. Without exception the staff were miserable and did as little as they needed to do. This caused a big problem as we were travelling with our two teenage daughters, both over 16 years and although the web site had let me book a room for two people this apparantly wasn't allowed so when we checked in I was told I'd need another room... for a further 80 euros. My daughter is fluent in Spanish (I know none) and she attempted to negotiate a compromise but the receptionist was having none of it. This same receptionist then spoke to a colleague in Spanish in a most disparaging way about me, I know this as my daughter heard it and translated it for me. All the while this went on there was a receptionist nearby who spoke good English, we know this because we heard her with another client, who steadfastly refused to get involved. Rather than ruin a precious weekend away with our kids I paid up and we had the second, unnecessary, room. When I got home I took this up with Novotel who, to be fair, have apologised and offered me a free night which I intend to use. The sad thing is, it was probably my fault in the first place but the rude and unhelpful attitude of the staff made me dig my heels in. I should mention that if you are visiting Madrid city the hotel is not well placed but it is brilliant for the airport and conference area. It is a 2 minute walk from the Metro station and a 20 minute train ride into town. The hotel operates a courtesy bus to the airport which we used and that at least worked perfectly. In recommending this hotel I would advise you to be prepared for a less than warm and welcoming reception and do not waste your money buying food here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tikibird
Reviews.Content: We were attracted here by a great deal on the Accor website and the chance to use Accor vouchers but it turned out to be a great choice. Free convenient shuttle was right on time, the room was clean and decent and the metro to go downtown only 5 minutes walk. Free wifi in the room and great service all around!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: roadtrip16states
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel near the airport. First of all, has a free shuttle every 30min airport-hotel-airport, very usefull. The staff was helpful, and the room was great. Also has 2 pools. Negative point to the AC, it was broken, and has no breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PoorestTourists
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is a great airport hotel close to Madrid Barajas Airport. We were coming in from Morocco and had one night in Madrid before our flight the next day to the US. Novotel is so convenient because there is a free airport shuttle (!) that runs about every half hour. When we arrived, the service was great--the staff is multilingual. The rooms are pretty nice, especially considering the price. And there is a free business center in the lobby! The hotel is located in a business area so there are plenty of cheap restaurants open during the week. We went on a weekend so some of the close cafeteria style restaurants were closed. We just took a short walk and found a great restaurant: Turn right out of the hotel and make a left when you get to the road. This should be Av de Capital d'Espana Madrid. At the roundabout (with a statue in the middle of it) look for a big McDonald's "M" in the distance and head towards it. Turn left just before you get to McD. It is called FresCo. It is 10 EURO for dinner all-you-can-eat including a soda. Great deal and yummy. There are also some other restaurants in this same area, probably only a 10 minute walk from the hotel. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant since it was quite expensive. I wouldn't really recommend staying here if you are visiting Madrid on vacation (though it is close to a metro stop if you want to go into downtown for the day) since it is more of a business hotel in a business area. But given the free perks like the airport shuttle (taxis would be like $30-40 each way), free business center, and the really nice outdoor pool, we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's not a standard Novotel”
Reviews.Author: davethewasp
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel situated one metro stop from Terminals 1, 2 and 3 of Barajas airport and only 4 stops to the start of downtown Madrid. It has a good restaurant and a very good swimming pool. Rooms are fine and, all in all, it was a perfect base for a 2 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you're a sloppy, chain smoker with screaming kids avoid this one”
Reviews.Author: VonWandurer
Reviews.Content: We moved out of this place and went to the Holiday Inn Express by the airport. This hotel is a stinker and does not match the photos or positive reviews. It does have a shuttle bus to the airport, but it seems to run hourly so time it well. It is close to the Metro so that's a definite plus. The lobby has marble and you walk in with great hopes, but the ambivalent staff begins to dash those hopes. We had a non-smoking room, but I think that simply means a live smoke isn't present. The A/C system pumps smoke into your room regardless and your pillows, towels, and sheets stink like smoke. I live in Europe so I'm fairly used to smoke, but wow, this was like renting an ashtray. The carpet was stained, you need to pay to watch tv, the breakfast was free but you can only eat so much dried ham, chocolate donuts, and stale cereal. If it was 50 Euros a night I guess I wouldn't complain, but it's almost triple that. Recommend you stay closer to Plaze Mayor in a quaint cozy place that's easier to navigate from. Oh, this was my second bad experience in a Novotel, so No-vo-more. Oh, it does have a pool, but it was closed while I was there despite the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: gizmoguycdn
Reviews.Content: I was just connecting and stayed over night to meet up with a friend as this hotel was close to him. It's conveniently located , rooms are clean. Service needs a lot of improvement but again that's Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and the best breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DVholidays
Reviews.Content: The location was incredible, the staff was friendly and the breakfast was simply amazing. We definitely recommend it and we will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good for budget and first time travel to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: MarusanTaipei
Reviews.Content: went there for CPhi 1. Close to bus stop(in front of hotel) to convention center and city center 2. Good service attitude 3. Some staffs speak good English

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: Supermercado
Reviews.Content: Usual Novotel with all renovated & large rooms, close from the airport. City centre 30 minutes with metro system (station within 3 min. walk). Just stayed one night but had no problem. Soundproof was great (heard nothing and the hotel was busy). A wise airport hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel - close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: 2009sunseeker
Reviews.Content: I always read trip advisor when I am searching for hotels therefore having just complete a 2 week tour of Spain and Portugal I decided to write some hotel reviews. We stayed at the Novotel Campo de Las Naciones near Madrid airport just prior to leaving Madrid. We returned our rental car to the airport and hitched a ride on their complimentary shuttle back to the hotel. The hotel is a stone’s throw – literally 5 minutes walk to the Metro station and within ½ hour we were at the Sol Metro station in Puerto del Sol Madrid – in the heart of old Madrid. This hotel is very nice, with a business center where you can print your boarding pass. The room was spacious with a large safe, mini fridge, free Wi Fi and a large comfortable queen bed – truly a luxury in Europe. This hotel does cater to business professionals. The check in staff was pleasant and helpful. They don’t have anyone to help with your bags, but they have several of the carts used at the airport to transport luggage so you can do it yourself without much issue. The restaurant was excellent – great food, good wine, service was a bit slow – but to be expected in Spain. We had dinner and buffet breakfast at this hotel – both were fabulous. The hotel has a swimming pool and room service – what more could you want. This is a great business hotel for groups and meetings, close to the airport with complimentary shuttle service and close to the Metro if you want to get downtown or anywhere in Madrid (Madrid has a fabulous subway system). I would recommend staying at one of the many very nice hotels in Madrid near Puerto del Sol, on the Gran Via, or Plaza Major if you do not have a car or want to experience the flavor of Madrid – but as an airport or business hotel this one is fantastic. Our flight was early the next morning and we were very happy we chose this hotel for our last 2 nights in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice simple family and Business Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: feliz79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Novotel during peak season but wasn't many Business travellers as it's August. Kids stay for free so of course many spanish familes take advantage of this. The service was good and of course i know often depends on who serves you on front desk and bar. I want to add that the Hotel offers a FREE 20 minute internet usage which i think is good and you can you this as many times as you like. I think this is better than nothing and a quick fix as many have complained about the usage in their rooms. The location i think is good as this is my thrid trip to Madrid and i know my way around the metro pretty well. Nice and quiet area and honestly it's not that far from town i think some people are being lazy! Was a pleasant stay the rooms were nice and food average.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.proximity to the airport”
Reviews.Author: jai97
Reviews.Content: We had taken 2 rooms for 3 nights and had made a booking thro the Paris hotel at La Defense.We made an extra booking for an addl night from malaga but got a much higher rate. Bfast was separate not like their La Defense property where the bfast was included in their price.The metro is located just 50 mts from the hotel so getting into the city was a breeze.The main reason was the proximity of the hotel to the airport and the free shuttle service. The hotel is located in a Business district so there are no restaurants around the hotel. Mc Donalds is 10 mts walk away. The kids enjoyed rollerblading on the roads late eve since there was absolutely no traffic. We had a good time but basically just used the hotel as a base so did not use most of the facilities in the property.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting prices”
Reviews.Author: calcavecia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for a night - the rooms were above average and the location for us wasn't the best, but excellent with good transport links to where we wanted to go (it wouldn't be ideally situated however for anyone wanting to easily visit central London). However .... on our confirmation email it listed Breakfast under the room and on arrival we were told what times breakfast was served at.

Reviews.Title: “Business only!”
Reviews.Author: jw6969
Reviews.Content: I say business only - actually it is a convenient airport hotel too as it has a frequent and free airport shuttle bus, shared with the Sofitel (now Pullman) next door. I use this hotel several times a year whe visiting trade shows at the Feria, as the hotel is just 5 minutes walk away. sometimes I also stay at the superior Sofitel/Pullman as when the Novotel is nearly full, I have found the Sofitel to cost LESS!! It is a typical Novotel, full or trade show visitors/exhibitors. The bar is always buzzing, the restaurant is surprisingly good and the staff always seem helpful. Rooms are standard Novotel type. Many have been renovated recently. All clean and comfortable. It is miles from the City centre, but the tube is on your doorstep. It is cheap and will get you into town in no time. If you are spending all your time at the Feria (which I tend to do), and then head back to the airport, the Novotel saves time and money getting into and out of the City centre. Highly reccommended (as is the Sofitel/Pullman next door). Only slight irritation is the swimming pool which opens on the 1st June - why?? I've been there in April/May when it has been baking hot!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Novotel with Free Shuttle to Airport and Next to Metro Station”
Reviews.Author: Antoines
Reviews.Content: Its a nice hotel, as any NOVOTEL the rooms are pretty the same in each place. superior rooms its nicer,, new desing and more services,,coffe and tea available in room, also a minibar, the shower with 3 massage functions and proper amenities in bathroom. is just one metro station from airport, so even when airport shuttle is free and 24 hrs available, it is really not that needed as metro station is just outside the hotel ( about one block , 2 minutes walking ) and the next metro station is barajas airport. so if you are looking for a nice hotel near aiport this is the one, or if you prefer to stay outside city center but well conected this is also the one. for a 65 euros night i guess is a fine deal.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK Business Hotel, Poor Location for Tourism”
Reviews.Author: PMTexas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an Oil & Gas Trade Show for one week. The location is worst ever for tourism: you need to pay about 40 Euros to get to downtown. Customer Service is irregular in terms of quality, but it's excusable since it's a French hotel chain in Madrid (Spaniards are not that polite, you know...). For instance, to get a good and efficient service at front desk, depends on the guy/gal will take care of you. Hotel room is aseptic clean and look likes brand-new, like one from Courtyard Marriot: spacious and very nice. Cable TV programming is a bad joke and you need to pay for good channels. Internet is also charged on the side and painfully slow for a business hotel. There is no way to get a nice room view because hotel is located close to nowhere (except business buildings). Bed is amazingly comfortable, though. For some weird reason you don't have any control of room temperature and hotel customer service staff really does not care about this issue. Don't try to complain about it. Hotel restaurant is fancy, but all food (believe me: I tasted every single plate from the menu) is bland and completely forgettable. That's a big deal, since you are in Spain, country of exquisite cuisine whatever you go. The big advantage is the price - very fair, compare to the other hotels in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for an Airport Hotel with city access.”
Reviews.Author: Porthos
Reviews.Content: I selected the Novotel Campo de las Naciones because of a great rate, and it's proximity to both the airport ( less than 5 mins via hotel shuttle that runs every 30 mins) and to a Metro stop that is only about 100 metres away. The hotel is typical Novotel; the pool is average size but very clean, the staff were efficient and everything went jsut as planned. It only takes about 20 mins to get to the heart of Madrid by Metro with just 1, or 2 line changes depending on how close you want to get to your specific site of interest. We were able to spend a great evening downtown before our flight despite getting in about 5:00 p.m. because it all went so smoothly with the shuttle / check-in / Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Airport hotel, access to town”
Reviews.Author: JQFlor
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers minibus service to and from Madrid Barajas airport, about 15 minute ride. It also sits next to a Metro station, so one can go to central Madrid in 45-60 minutes. Simple, modern room. Internet access is for a fee only. Breakfast is excellent: array of hams and cheeses, hot eggs and meats, fresh fruit, excellent bread, pastry, cereal, yogurt and fruit juice. Location has no walkable attractions or restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: dredge
Reviews.Content: I go to Madrid a lot to work (I'm a journalist) and I have stayed twice at Novotel. It's a great place, with friendly people, quiet rooms and a decent breakfast. Besides, it offers free shuttle to Barajas airport and has a Subway station just accross the street!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: RanyDanny
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the airport and it's one of the newest in the area. Rooms are great and staff was very nice. They have a special rate over the weekend (when the hotel is usually empty) which is lower than anything in the area. Shuttle service to and from the airport, very convinient. Internet service in the room, a little bit more expensive than in other hotels, but very good and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anderwitz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a trip to Spain. We stayed at the Novotel the night before our early morning flight back to the USA. Our room was quiet and located on a non-smoking floor (the first I've seen in Europe). Our king size bed was comfortable and the room was clean and spacious. Although we didn't use it, the pool liked nice. The staff doesn't speak English very well but they seemed helpful. The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle service to the airport. This is a good hotel to stay at if you need to be close to the airport. Otherwise, there's absolutely nothing to do within walking distance.
